chapter.title: Running the jax-doclets
chapter.para: The jax-doclets are run by JavaDoc either as standalone or via ant.
chapter.remark: Since the JAX-RS supports links to JAXB documentation, you should first run the JAXB doclet, then the JAX-RS doclet using the -link parameter.

section.title: JAXB doclet
section.para: You can use the following ant XML to run the JAXB doclet on your code:

figure.title: Ant XML for running the JAXB doclet
figure.programlisting: <target name="doc-jaxb" depends="jars" description="Run the JAXB doclet"> <javadoc doclet="com.lunatech.doclets.jax.jaxb.JAXBDoclet" docletpath="lib/jax-doclets-0.5.jar"> <package name="com.lunatech.doclets.jax.test.*"/> </javadoc> </target>

section.title: JAX-RS doclet
section.para: You can use the following ant XML to run the JAX-RS doclet on your code:

figure.title: Ant XML for running the JAX-RS doclet
figure.programlisting: <target name="doc-jaxrs" depends="jars" description="Run the JAXRS doclet"> <javadoc doclet="com.lunatech.doclets.jax.jaxrs.JAXRSDoclet" docletpath="lib/jax-doclets-0.5.jar"> <package name="com.lunatech.doclets.jax.test.*"/> </javadoc> </target>
